content:
TerminateActivity Class

In this Article

Terminates the running workflow instance when an abnormal situation occurs. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TerminateDesigner), typeof(System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner))]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(typeof(System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem))]
[System.Drawing.ToolboxBitmap(typeof(System.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity), "Resources.Terminate.png")]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public sealed class TerminateActivity : System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DependencyObject
  • System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity
  • TerminateActivity

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

TerminateActivity immediately ends the execution of the current workflow instance. Unlike a suspended workflow instance, a terminated workflow instance can never be resumed.

Constructors summary

TerminateActivity()

Initializes a new instance of the TerminateActivity class.
TerminateActivity(String)

Initializes a new instance of the TerminateActivity class using the name of the activity.

Fields summary

ErrorProperty

Represents the DependencyProperty that targets the stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity.Error* property.

Properties summary

Error

Gets or sets an error message to report to administrators, providing the reason for termination.

Methods summary

Execute(ActivityExecutionContext)
Initialize(IServiceProvider)

Constructors

  • TerminateActivity()

    Initializes a new instance of the TerminateActivity class.

    public TerminateActivity ();

    Remarks

    The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the TerminateActivity class.

    Property Value
    Error null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    Example

    This example illustrates using the constructor for a TerminateActivity, and other things discussed elsewhere within this type.

    This code example is part of the Suspend and Terminate SDK sample and is from the SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow.Designer.cs file. For more information, see Using Suspend and Terminate. 

    [System.Diagnostics.DebuggerNonUserCode()]
private void InitializeComponent()
{
    this.CanModifyActivities = true;
    this.suspend = new System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity();
    this.consoleMessage = new System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity();
    this.terminate = new System.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity();
    // 
    // suspend
    // 
    this.suspend.Error = null;
    this.suspend.Name = "suspend";
    // 
    // ConsoleMessage
    // 
    this.consoleMessage.Name = "consoleMessage";
    this.consoleMessage.ExecuteCode += new System.EventHandler(this.OnConsoleMessage);
    // 
    // terminate
    // 
    this.terminate.Error = null;
    this.terminate.Name = "terminate";
    // 
    // SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow
    // 
    this.Activities.Add(this.suspend);
    this.Activities.Add(this.consoleMessage);
    this.Activities.Add(this.terminate);
    this.Name = "SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow";
    this.CanModifyActivities = false;
}


    <System.Diagnostics.DebuggerNonUserCode()> _
                            Private Sub InitializeComponent()

    Me.CanModifyActivities = True
    Me.suspend = New System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity()
    Me.consoleMessage = New System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity()
    Me.terminate = New System.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity()
    ' 
    ' suspend
    ' 
    Me.suspend.Error = Nothing
    Me.suspend.Name = "suspend"
    ' 
    ' ConsoleMessage
    ' 
    Me.consoleMessage.Name = "consoleMessage"
    AddHandler Me.consoleMessage.ExecuteCode, AddressOf Me.OnConsoleMessage
    ' 
    ' terminate
    ' 
    Me.terminate.Error = Nothing
    Me.terminate.Name = "terminate"
    ' 
    ' SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow
    ' 
    Me.Activities.Add(Me.suspend)
    Me.Activities.Add(Me.consoleMessage)
    Me.Activities.Add(Me.terminate)
    Me.Name = "SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow"
    Me.CanModifyActivities = False
End Sub
  • TerminateActivity(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the TerminateActivity class using the name of the activity.

    public TerminateActivity (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The user-defined name of the activity.

Fields

  • ErrorProperty

    Represents the DependencyProperty that targets the stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity.Error* property.

    public static readonly System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty ErrorProperty;

    Example

    This example illustrates initializing the Error property for a TerminateActivity, and other things discussed elsewhere within this type.

    This code example is part of the Suspend and Terminate SDK sample and is from the SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow.Designer.cs file. For more information, see Using Suspend and Terminate. 

    [System.Diagnostics.DebuggerNonUserCode()]
private void InitializeComponent()
{
    this.CanModifyActivities = true;
    this.suspend = new System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity();
    this.consoleMessage = new System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity();
    this.terminate = new System.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity();
    // 
    // suspend
    // 
    this.suspend.Error = null;
    this.suspend.Name = "suspend";
    // 
    // ConsoleMessage
    // 
    this.consoleMessage.Name = "consoleMessage";
    this.consoleMessage.ExecuteCode += new System.EventHandler(this.OnConsoleMessage);
    // 
    // terminate
    // 
    this.terminate.Error = null;
    this.terminate.Name = "terminate";
    // 
    // SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow
    // 
    this.Activities.Add(this.suspend);
    this.Activities.Add(this.consoleMessage);
    this.Activities.Add(this.terminate);
    this.Name = "SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow";
    this.CanModifyActivities = false;
}


    <System.Diagnostics.DebuggerNonUserCode()> _
                            Private Sub InitializeComponent()

    Me.CanModifyActivities = True
    Me.suspend = New System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity()
    Me.consoleMessage = New System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity()
    Me.terminate = New System.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity()
    ' 
    ' suspend
    ' 
    Me.suspend.Error = Nothing
    Me.suspend.Name = "suspend"
    ' 
    ' ConsoleMessage
    ' 
    Me.consoleMessage.Name = "consoleMessage"
    AddHandler Me.consoleMessage.ExecuteCode, AddressOf Me.OnConsoleMessage
    ' 
    ' terminate
    ' 
    Me.terminate.Error = Nothing
    Me.terminate.Name = "terminate"
    ' 
    ' SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow
    ' 
    Me.Activities.Add(Me.suspend)
    Me.Activities.Add(Me.consoleMessage)
    Me.Activities.Add(Me.terminate)
    Me.Name = "SuspendAndTerminateWorkflow"
    Me.CanModifyActivities = False
End Sub

Properties

  • Error

    Gets or sets an error message to report to administrators, providing the reason for termination.

    public string Error { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      An error message that provides the reason for the workflow instance termination. The default value is null.

    Remarks

    If this property is set when the activity is in runtime mode (the DesignMode property is set to false) a ReadOnlyException is thrown.

    Propagation of this error message is determined by the host (the instance manager or the persistence provider).

    Example

    The following example demonstrates setting the Error property. This example is from the Suspend and Terminate SDK sample. For more information, see Suspend and Terminate Sample. 

    this.terminate.Error = null;

    Me.terminate.Error = Nothing
